events.name: GCDC PH Inaugural/Next '18 Extended Port Harcourt
events.description:
Google Cloud Next ’18 Extended Port Harcourt is an extension of the main conference that happened on the 24-26th of July in San Francisco, CA. The local event will entail a recap of the Conference, talks and workshops.

Next Extended allows local developers to access exciting Next ‘18 content and engage with the community through local speakers, activities, and hands-on labs.

Agenda

1) Streams of relevant keynotes and sessions
2) Local speakers from our community
3) Hands-on Codelabs: Qwiklabs

The main objective of the event is to increase awareness and engagement of developers of what they can leverage on Google Cloud Platform.

Make sure you come with a Laptop and if possible, an extension

events.name: DevFest South-South Nigeria - 2018
events.description:
GDG DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies. This year's event will be hosted in Uyo, Akwa Ibom State.

Topics

Flutter
Actions on Google
Firebase
PWA - Prosper
Machine Learning
Artificial Intelligence
Android
Cloud

Visit this website to reserve a ticket visit www.devfestss.tech

events.name: GCDC Port Harcourt  Cloud Study Jam 2019
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with Google Cloud Speech API, Cloud SQL, BigQuery, Cloud ML Engine and Google Genomics.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

What to bring to the event

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Event Agenda

11:00 pm Welcome Address!
11:05 pm Get free access to Qwiklabs
11:10 pm Lab 1: Introduction to SQL
11:45 pm Lab 2: BigQuery Qwik Start
12:10 pm Lab 3: CloudML Engine Qwik Start
1:00 pm Break
1:00 pm Cloud Speech API
2:00 pm Event ends - THANK YOU!

events.name: Google I/O Extended Port Harcourt
events.description:
Google I/O Extended is focused on bringing the local developers community together to experience the keynote and other main Google I/O sessions.

This year, we will be having a one-day event for code-labs and speaker session to have a deep dive into Google latest products and innovations.

Event Agenda
10:00 am - Welcome
10:10 am - Google I/O keynote and sessions
11:00 am - Review of I/O keynotes and sessions
11:15 am - Lab 1: Firebase Android Codelab - Build Friendly Chat
12:15 pm - Using Google Technologies in the iOS ecosystem.
12:30 pm - Break/Refreshment
12:40 pm - Lab 2: Learn Tensorflow 1: The Hello World of Machine Learning
1:40 pm - Conclusion / Photo sessions
2:00 pm - Event Ends.

(Lab 1)
- You would learn how to use the Firebase Platform on Android.
- Allow users to sign in.
- Sync data using the Firebase Real-time Database.
- Store binary files in Firebase
What you need
- Android Studio version 3.4+.
- A test device with Android 2.3+ and Google Play services 9.8 or later, or
an Emulator with Google Play services 9.8 or later
- A USB connection cable.

(Lab 2)
- You would learn the basic 'Hello World of Machine Learning.
- You will build a system that is trained on data to infer the rules that
determine a relationship between numbers

What to bring to the event
Bring a laptop, charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! + extension cable. The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Thank you.

events.name: Application Load Balancing with Kubernetes
events.description:
Application Load Balancing with Kubernetes
Attendees would learn:
1. How to create a Kubernetes Cluster with it's built in load balancer

2. Deploy nginx application into the cluster and test that it is working.

3. Undeploy the application.

4. Redeploy the Kubernetes Cluster using ingress to connect it to a Google Compute Engine HTTPS load by-balancer.

5. Redeploy the nginx application to the cluster and test.

6. How to build a docker image using docker file

7. How to deploy a docker container using docker-compose

8. Case study: Building Personal Cloud File Server using NextCloud Container

9. Redeploy the Filer Server using Kubernetes for Load Balancing
events.how_to_find_us: 5 Ehule Lane, Ada George Road, PH. From ..Location, then enter Keke to Royal dynasty filling station,  then ask of 5 Ehule Lane.(or use Google Maps).

events.name: Cloud Study Jams
events.description:
What to Expect:
1. Fundamentals of Web Hosting
-Introduction to web hosting and domains.
- Difference between domain registration and hosting.
- Understanding different Types of hosting
- How buy a domain name and register it.
- Register a Free domain.
- Learn and get to Host a Website
-

2.Classify images of clouds in the cloud with AutoML Vision

AutoML Vision helps developers with limited ML expertise train high quality image recognition models. Once you upload images to the AutoML UI, you can train a model that will be immediately available on GCP for generating predictions via an easy to use REST API.

In this lab, we will upload images to Cloud Storage and use them to train a custom model to recognize different types of clouds (cumulus, cumulonimbus, etc.).

What you'll learn
-Uploading a labeled dataset to Google Cloud Storage and connecting it to AutoML Vision with a CSV label file
-Training a model with AutoML Vision and evaluating its accuracy
-Generating predictions on your trained model

2. Load and Analyze Data in BigQuery
BigQuery is a fully-managed, petabyte-scale, low-cost enterprise data warehouse for analytics. BigQuery is serverless. You do not need to set up and manage clusters.

A BigQuery dataset resides in a project. A dataset contains one or more tables with data.

In this session, you will use the BigQuery web UI to query public datasets, load your own data, and export data to a Cloud Storage bucket.

What you'll learn
How to query public datasets
How to load data into a table
How to export table data
events.how_to_find_us: From Eliozu,  take a cab going to Rupokwu, stop at SkyFall Plaza, just after Mattoris Supermarket.  Call:  08037619730

events.name: DevFest South-South Calabar - 2019
events.description:
DevFests are community-led developer events hosted by Google Developer Groups around the globe. GDGs are focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies. DevFests may cover multiple products such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Google Assistant, Flutter, machine learning with TensorFlow, and mobile web. Events may include speaker sessions, hackathons, codelabs, study jams, and training with speakers from Google, Google Developers Experts, Women Techmaker Ambassadors and speakers from other companies.

DevFest South-South brings together world-class experts in the above mentioned technologies to Calabar for a 1-day power packed sessions, workshops and various showcases.

This year, we are bringing the whole of the South-South regions to Calabar to experience this year's DevFest South-South Calabar.

www.devfestss.com

upcoming.name: Firebase Study Jam
upcoming.description:
Want to get started building web apps? Learn how to do that with Firebase!
Join us for our Firebase Study Jam! Together we'll work through Firebase for web/mobile codelabs prepared by Google instructors.

With a Firebase Study Jam, You will learn the capabilities of using Firebase for developing Web/mobile applications, share your experiences, and solve hands-on problems together.

Who should attend?
Firebase Study Jam is best suited for:
1) those just getting started with developing web apps for desktop and mobile
2) those with programming experience on web/mobile app frameworks
